Docs.summary: Defines properties that specify how ASP.NET creates client IDs for a data-bound control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.IDataKeysControl> interface defines two properties that data-bound controls implement to let you specify how a client ID is created. A data-bound control that displays multiple instances of a control must create an ID for each instance of the control. That ID must be unique in order to enable access to the control from client script.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.IDataKeysControl.ClientIDRowSuffix%2A> property lets you specify the name or names of data fields whose values are included in the generated value for the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.ClientID%2A> property. These values are used to uniquely identify each instance of the control in a way that corresponds to a meaningful data value, instead of to an arbitrary value such as the order in which the controls are rendered on the page. For example, when you display records from a products data table, you can assign `ProductID` to the <xref:System.Web.UI.IDataKeysControl.ClientIDRowSuffix%2A> property. In that case, each instance of the data-bound control can be identified by the value from the `ProductID` field.

Docs.summary: Gets the names of the data fields whose values are used to uniquely identify each instance of a data-bound control when ASP.NET generates the value by using the algorithm.
Gets a collection of the data values that are used to uniquely identify each instance of a data-bound control when ASP.NET generates the value.
